text: Growler - pours gold white head - nose and taste of grassy citrus, grapefruit, orange peel and caramel malt - medium body
Poured a semi hazy golden color with a white head. Aroma waa big Mosaic, pineapple and underripened melon. Flavor similar, a little sweet and boozy like most of their doubles.

Draught. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a large, foamy white head. Aroma is floral, light pine, some grapefruit-y citrus, light honey, and grass. Taste is light peach, dough, grapefruit, vanilla, earth, very light pineapple, a touch of pine, and a hint of onion. Finish is vanilla and onion. Light-medium body. Soft carbonation. Creamy, fluffy mouthfeel.
Shared growler. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a decent white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, pine, and malt. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, mango, melon, pine, and malt. Superb.

Huge mosaic bomb! Appearance is hazy, light golden orange with a fingers worth of head. Aroma is huge tropical fruits, citrus, pine. Flavor fallows the aroma, light berry, and huge tropical fruit up front. Medium body, fairly dry, and smooth bitterness. Incredible mosaic IIPA.

It pours cloudy orange with a small white head. The aroma has creamy pineapple, orange, rich malt and a bit of vanilla. It has a fairly full rich body with soft carbonation. The taste starts out like the aroma, but the finish has citrus, grapefruit zest, spice and mango, but pineapple is still very much on there. Very nice. Thanks to gregwilsonstl for sharing this gem.
Very turbid. Light. Dry. Very tasty. Pineapple. Nowhere near as fruity as the other VT beers ive owned.. Thx thepatrickman

750ml growler pours cloudy orange with finger of head. Lots of dank orange juice and grapefruit bitterness, big grassy notes with some herbal and tropical bits and light melon. Balanced, soft mouthfeel, citrus zest, grapefruit, dank, delicious.

750mL growler filled 4/29/16 and drunk 5/4/16.Heavily hazy/cloudy peach-golden with deeper rust tints and a large, very-well-retained white head.Big juicy fruit, sweet pine, ruby red grapefruit and marmalade notes are immediately boisterous and fairly intense, especially for Hill Farmstead. Malts behind it show rich honey tending to light caramel. Its funny, this is probably the 3rd or 4th mosaic IPA/pale ale where it comes off much less what I associate with mosaic. But blending hops can unlock and vastly alter a hop profile, so its not too surprising. Anyways, I usually expect tons of dank, leafy, slightly woody notes, with plentiful nectarine and pine. I guess theres a fair amount of that here, but Im surprised at all of the ruby red grapefruit and peachy-pine twang. Alcohol is well-concealed with just a moderate amount of resin lingering and no flaws.Juicy, of course, in the mouth, with rich nectarine, caramel, ruby red grapefruit and pine all blending together to add a powerful flavor. Kind of like Trilliums Scaled Up, but taken another notch past that on both malt, hop flavor and bitterness. Lots of honey-like maltiness with a touch of caramel. Tight carbonation leading to a malty-creamy texture and no flaw or alcohol. Theres a bit more resin than Id like and some heavy hop twang at points, but its still very juicy, intensely flavorful and enjoyable (if tending maybe a touch sweet).

On retrouve lapparence habituelle des ipa de cette brasserie. Une texture en bouche extrêmement soyeuse et tellement fraîche! Des arômes dananas, de melon miel, dherbe et meme de banane dansent en parfaites harmonies dans ma bouche. Sublime!

On draft at the brewery. In my experience, Ive found Mosaic hops tend to taste strongly like either "tropical fruit" or "oniony feet." So, I approached this one with a little bit of trepidation. As it turns out, though, this is Mosaic hops done really right -- its just waves of ripe mangoes and juicy pineapples. Great DIPA.

Where and how:  on tap at Prohibition Pig 
Aroma: of Vermont essence. This is what Vermont IPA style is. Sift, rounded yet rich and vivid. Gentler side of grassy hops and well developed malts. It does not disappoint.
 Appearance : 4+ .
Top: white, large, long lasting with lace and rings.
Base: murky gold
Palate :  medium full bodied, milder softer carbonation. Smooth, complex with medium-potent intensity and finish.
Taste: Mature set up of this double IPA. Grapefruit, citrus hops with supporting not too sweet malt bottom. Balanced supporting alcohol warmth. Very drinkable.
 other notes  Very Vermont, Very H.F

Draft to big (half pour) taster at Prohibition Pig. Looks good; a hazy pineapplish orange with foamy eggshell head. Smells good too, fruity and piney with a moderately bittersweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with a semi-bitter medium to medium full-bodied mouthfeel. A good example of the style.

Hazy golden orange in color... Aroma of dank hops, tropical fruits, juicy mangoes, tangerines, pineapple... Flavor is tropical fruits, pineapple, mangoes, dank hop notes... Delicious 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler rapporté à la maison. Encore une bière profondément bien brassée sur la colline vermontoise. Beaucoup de mousse au service. Celle-ci étant de durée moyenne, le liquide dans mon verre se retrouve raidement dénudé. Nez où le malt tend galamment la main au houblon. Une dose mesurée de grains et un houblon vert parfaitement balancé. Une valse de fruits tropicaux sur un air de printemps nordique. Toujours ce mouthfeel absolument fabuleux; Signature de la Maison. Juste assez citronnée, soyeuse - presque laiteuse. Une résine agréable sacoquinant à un fruit de la passion exotique. Alcool présent, plaisir grand!

Growler. Pours hazy orange with a White. Aroma of tropical hops, multi juice, rest sugar, orange, pineapple, mango, quite sweet from rest sugar the mosaic hops. Taste is rather sweet, tho very balanced, quite bitter, house flavor. Extreme balance.

Growler thanks to Charles. Pours a cloudy orange gold with medium frothy white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is strong tropical fruit, mango and tangerine, dank hop, pine. Slick mouthfeel, juicy dank, tropical fruit, light bitterness, nice booze, really enjoyed this.

Draft at Armsby Abbey. Poured a hazy lighter orange/yellow with a nice sudsy white head. Aromas of citrus and tropical fruit, pine, onion, dank. Flavor was lemon, grapefruit, mango, pine, onion, dank. Medium body, smooth texture, soft carbonation, easy finish.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 750ml growler bought today @Hill Farmstead. Aroma: great intense aroma of juicy tropical fruits, grapefruits and pines. App: hazy light orange, medium white head, nice lacing with lots of small bubbles covering the side of my glass. Taste and palate: medium body, silky, clean lingering bitter finish. Overall: pretty good. Wish this would be in a can because this is something I would drink from the can in the pool. Aroma is so fruity, feels so fresh. Would be curious to do a blind tasting with HT and SOS. Great job again HF!

Poured from growler into a tulip: Pours hazy orange with a foamy white head. Aroma of lemon, grapefruit, tropical notes, papaya. Taste is more of the same, with garlic, scallions, and some resin in the back end. Medium body, soft mouthfeel, a nice bite from the hops but well balanced with the citrus and malt sweetness. Excellent beer.

750 mL growler. Originally reviewed 5/25/2013.

Hazy orange body with some sediment floating inside. Nice white head that nearly overflows the glass. Impressive sticky lacing down the sides.

 Incredibly complex aroma from what is effectively a single hop. Tropical fruit, citrus, pine, and a nice herbal character reminiscent of a Lawsons IPA. Really nice.

Taste is incredible, but doesnt quite reach the heights of the aroma. Citrusy, but the tropical fruits dont come through as much as the pine and herbal characters do. I go for tropical fruit more than the other flavors, but its still excellent. Just a little bit of sweetness behind it all.
Low sweetness, medium carbonation. Not quite the body of a double IPA, which is nice. Never feels heavy and is impressively drinkable.

Stunning, as always, from Hill Farmstead. That one hop is delivering all of this flavor is all the more impressive.

Huge thanks to sideshowe for picking this up for me!

Pours a cloudy golden orange color with banana yellow edges and a one finger frothy white head that slowly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Good retention with large streaks of soapy lacing coating the glass. 

Floral, earthy hop aroma with resinous, grassy pine notes along with a subtle sweaty/onion-y character that countered by tropical and citrus fruit sweetness and a pale malt backbone. Not very familiar with mosaic hops but this beer smells pretty complex. Dank and sticky with hints of spruce tip, grass and pine needle followed by subtle citrus rind, grapefruit and pineapple. Again, some vegetal, onion/scallion character with some bread and biscuit underneath. 

Full bodied with a slightly creamy texture and a blast of earthy, sticky hops which provide crisp, dry bitterness that lingers over the sweeter fruit notes and pale malts into a dry finish. Aggressive bitterness up front with resinous oils and grassy pine needle flavor. Theres also a bit of that onion like character but its not as strong as the nose suggests and fades a bit after it warms and the palate adjusts. The bitterness is countered by subtle citrus and tropical fruit notes, especially grapefruit, mango and lemon peel. Underneath, there is a pale malt backbone thats strong enough to perfectly balance things out without interfering with the hops. Some bread/yeast character along with biscuit and graham cracker. 

The most surprising aspect of this beer is how drinkable it is. Even though its full bodied and aggressively bitter up front, its perfectly balanced by the sweeter notes and malt backbone. Complex and flavorful with a crisp and refreshing finish that leaves me immediately craving another sip. I had to slow myself down and savor it before I blazed through the whole growler. Another great beer from Hill Farmstead!

Growler from HF. Pours a bright golden color, some haze, pillowing white head that fades to a ring. Aromas of straight snake juice! I am a sucker for Mosaic hops and this hits the spot. Light cereal malt medley keeps the hop overload in check. Taste follows the nose but this has some extra bitter bite to it. Nice tropical fruits, snake juice...and then a semi-assertive bitter bite. Really nice beer, clean profile and soft palate....HF hits the mark again!

Growler @ 5 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Thanks to Leighton! Hazy gold with a small white head. The nose is fantastic. Bright and nuanced. Jasmine tea and mandarin orange. Honey comb and beeswax. Some tropical fruits, mango smoothie. Taste has some citrus fruit character, grapefruit and oranges. Modest cake-like sweetness. Growing leafy green bitterness on the finish. Some musty peach skin. Light and zippy. Drinks below its ABV. Very good.
Smell of graprefruit. Taste of citrus followed by a smooth and long bitterness.

Growler shared at the 5K/7.5K/10K tasting - who the shitshines has a 7.5K tasting anyway? big thanks to once again to that man Leighton for more HF goodness, 30/12/14. 
Hazed orange amber with a decent off white covering that dissipates then retains.
Nose is juicy citrics, pine, straw, tangerine, mandarin, fresh grass.
Taste comprises tangerine, pine needle, orange pith, grassy, light grapefruit.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a balanced level of hop bitterness.
Crushable stuff, drinks well below the ABV, solid hop jus. I can normally pick out Mosaic easily but didnt do so here.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Growler. Milky golden yellow pour with a white head. Fruity hop aromas. Delicious with bitter hop notes and tropical fruit backbeats. Nice malty presence to keep her in check. Really good mouthfeel. Good body. Bravo!!!

Growler. Soft off-white head atop clear light amber body, nice lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, grape, some orange, grapefruit. Taste is moderately sweet, grape, orange, some grapefruit. Medium body, some resin, light stickiness.

30th December 20145 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Big thanks to Leighton. Light haze on this pale gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth and light with decent fine carbonation. Smooth light pale malts, mild creamy sweetness. Nice mellow hop skunk, light pine and decent hop spice. Mild tropical fruits underneath. Light smooth finish with a mild bitter linger. Very smooth and well joined up.

750 ml growler brought back by Lunch, many thanks Paul! Pours a hazy golden orange with lasting off white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, dank hops, and citrus complexity. Flavor is same with delicious grassy and dank aspects. Medium bodied, bright carbonation, lingering bitter dank finish.

Growler shared by Clint. Nose is super danky and earthy. Lightly grainy. Taste is initially bitter then a smooth hoppy flavor. Earthy, slightly mineral. Really good but not mind blowing. I prefer mosaic showers.

Shit yeah, number 47, in line at mbcp, thanks a ton! Pours cloudy golden amber, medium creamy white head, great lacing. Aroma is lovely, dank, tropical, pine resin. Flavor is light sweet, light plus butter, mineral water. Medium body, soft silky mouthfeel. Yummy.

From a growler, 3 days old. Pours a slightly hazy straw blonde, with a fluffy white head. Aromas of pine needles, lime, citrus and fruit salad. Medium body, fluffy mouthfeel, super fruit salad flavors, spiciness from the hops, almost peppery. Superbe double IPA. Hats off!

Growler big thanks to Leighton. It pours hazy gold with a a decent white head. The nose is soft, sweet, juicy, tangerine, sherbet, sweet orange, straw and light earth. The taste is crisp, bitter, super juicy, orange, tangerine, pomelo, earth, grass, minerals, straw, light alcohol and pepper with a dry, fruity finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Well rounded and particularly drinkable.

Growler from the brewery. Pours clear gold with a frothy, white head. Nice aroma with rich grapefruit notes. Medium sweet flavor, more juicy grapefruit, melon, pale bread. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Juicy, resinius finish with more grapefruit, mandarin orange, lemon. Nicely dank. Delicious.

Clear pale yellow, light white head. Grassy, slightly resinous nose. Predominantly bitter. Medium heavy mouthfeel, quite acidic, noticeably long aftertaste. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brown bottle, savoured on March 14 2014; eye: golden, lightly hazy, tiny ring of off-white head, no lacing; nose: tropical fruits, orange, light pine, light grapefruit; mouth: tropical fruits, orange, light pine, light grapefruit, light malt, dry finale in grapefruit with presence of orange, medium-full body, mildly bitter, lightly sweet, slick texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, savourée le 14 mars 2014; il : dorée, légèrement voilée, petit anneau de mousse blanc cassé, pas de dentelle; nez : fruits tropicaux, orange, léger pin, léger pamplemousse; bouche : fruits tropicaux, orange, léger pin, léger pamplemousse, léger malt, finale sèche en pamplemousse avec présence dorange, corps moyen-corsé, moyennement amère, légèrement sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien bon

Growler via Ian G. Hazy pale amber with a very nice white creamy head. First sniff makes me think of five alive, sweet and citrusy, high carbonation, dry, somewhat pulpy and yet clean and enjoyable / easy to drink.

On tap, Threepenny Taproom, Montpelier. Appearance is great - rich golden. Aroma is strong Mosaic hop, resin in the mix to the max. Taste is disappointing - bit thin for a dipa. Hop flavours are here but they dont linger in the way I look for. Fruitiness just doesnt burst out, which may be more down to the Mosaic hop foremost. Quite sessional. Bit of a bite on the finish. Dont love this quite as much as the other Vermont doubles, but appreciate the sessionability

Growler: Poured a hazy blonde color ale with a nice foamy head with good retention and light lacing. Aroma of tropical fruit is quite powerful with some nice apricot notes. Taste is also dominated by some huge notes of tropical fruit with some nice apricot notes with also some nice citrus notes. Body is full enough for style with good carbonation. Dominant floral hoppy notes makes for this a great treat.

En fût. Verre de dégustation directement à la brasserie au coût de 1,25$. Arôme: Odeur de fruits tropicaux. Apparence: La couleur est blonde opaque. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de fruits tropicaux avec une pointe de pamplemousse. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de citron en arrière goût. (Rating #5509)

On tap at Blackback pub on 3/22/14. Pours a hazy straw with a loose white head with large bubbles. Leaves a little spotty lacing. Nose is fruity, citrus. Taste is bright, fresh, peppery, nice hop bitterness, grapefruit. Great balance. Top notch beer

Une superposition de jus de fruits tropicaux qui mémeu à chaque gorgée. Une résine verdoyante sinvite graduellement au ruissellement et disparaît dans une belle et franche amertume. Buvabilté intimidante.

(Bottle) Pours hazy yellow-ish orange with a white head. The aroma is fantastic - bright and juicy with notes of pink grapefruit, melon, peach, strawberries, diesel and some new cut grass. Wow. The malt is tight on the nose with crackers and a touch of white bread. The flavour is light sweet to dry, medium bitter and tiny acidic with notes of tropical fruits, diesel and some green-ish tones. perfect malt profile. The mouthfeel is soft and almost creamy a light to medium carbonation. Medium afterbitterness. Light to medium bodied.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2014 Fliptop growler received in trade. Bottle filled 10 days ago and stored in fridge while not traveling. No leakage detected. Pours vibrant hazy and sparkling orangish yellow with a rather small frothy white head that leaves some sticky lacing and trace on the glass while slowly dissipating. Smell is very fruity, tiny earth, slightly herbal and bursting with fresh hop aroma with crackers, pink grapefruit juice, freshly cut grass, lemon grass, pine needles, water melon rinds, pineapple, passionfruit, honeydew melon, almost overripe mango and hints of diesel fuel, alcohol and chives. Taste is tiny sweet, slightly bitter, fruity and herbal with crackers, fresh white bread, pink grapefruit juice, freshly cut grass, pineapple, mango, grapefruit rinds, watermelon rinds, diesel fuel, lemon zest, orange zest and hints of alcohol and chives. Mouthfeel is round, slightly dry, slightly astringent, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is bitter and fruity with crackers, pink grapefruit juice, honeydew melon, watermelon rinds, orange zest, lemon zest, freshly cut grass, pine needles, lemon grass, pineapple, mango and hints of alcohol. The chives and diesel disappear almost completely as the beer warms. Very very tasty fruity IIPA. Top notch stuff!

A hazed blonde DIPA with a thin white head. In aroma, beautiful citrusy pulp and floral hops, biscuit malt, very nice yet simple. In mouth, a good grapefruit pulp and biscuit malt, floral and citrusy hops, smooth and quaffable. Growler from Ian Guenard.

Taster at the source. Pours orange yellow gold with a big clingy white head. Aroma is slight cereal, pineapple, mango. Very light and easy drinking for a double ipa with pineapple, mango citrus. Finish goes from sweet pineapple to bitter grapefruit.

Pours like the rest of HFS' golden children, cloudy golden orange with a fluffy white head. Melon pineapple and citrus zest on nose. In taste this is fruitier than some of their other undertakings, a little less subtle on that front but still so good. Cantaloupe and passionfruit taste, tropical rather than their "go-to" citrus or lemon. Super tasty

---Rated via Beer Buddy

My Bottom Line:
Tropical fruit juices burst from this Double IPA, leading the way to grassy hop resins and their salient bitterness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam laces atop the cloudy blond.
-The pungent bitterness detracts from the drinkability, but then again this IS a Double IPA...
-The tropical fruit character spans from passionfruit to peaches, from guava to plantanes, from citrus to lychee.
-Alcohol is not bothersome at all.

On tap at the brewery.

Pour looks like most HF IPAs, hazed bright yellow with small amount of tight white head. Nose is hop forward with faint malt balance and a hint of grain. Hops are tropical, grapefruit and mango with a touch of pine and herbal hops. Taste is more tropical fruit forward. Bright hops, mango and pear with a faint touch of herbal grassy hop through the finish. Bitterness is very light, mild carbonation with a medium to light body and juicy feel.

Growler into a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head, the perfect color of all HF beers. Aroma strong of citrus, tropical fruit, and floral notes from the hops plus a nice light maltiness that balances it oh so well. Flavor just a great blend of the strong hops and the light malts. Texture light and fluffy like almost all HF beers. Another stupidly good hoppy beer from HF.
Draft. Golden pour with white head. Super citrus, pineapple, and grassy hop aromas. Citrus heavy flavor, alcohol well hidden, more please.

A: Hazy Orange Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Great Lacing

S: Citrus, Grapefruit Rind, Piney

T: Citrus Rind, Crackers, Piney

M: Great Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Drying, Mildly Bitter

Overall, a solid DIPA with a nice blend of citrus, piney, and bittering hops. Solid.

In short: A highly aromatic, pillowy, fruity, uber-hoppy blond ale with a relatively smooth bitterness.  Drinks like a session beer.
How: Tap at Blackback Pub, Waterbury VT.  Then a growler at home consumed the day of purchase.
The look: Cloudy apricot-color body topped by a medium white head with good retention.
In long: Except for Society & Solitude #2 which was a enormously hoppy black ale most entries in the S&S series are variations on a common theme.  Same great HF blonde beer body, signature HF cushiony mouthfeel, as usual highly aromatic, typical low sweetness sensation and dangerously drinkability, and so on and so on  So whats different about this one?  The hopping is predominantly fruity  with piney undertones.  The fruity part focuses more on peaches, mangos, pineaples, other tropical fruits, this means not much grapefruits and lemons and this makes for a less sharp and less biting bitterness even if the beer is hopped to the max.  Maybe my favorite entry in the series, right up my alley.  Am I immature if I giggle every time I see that beer name because the & in the name looks like a little baby dragging his ass on the floor.

On tap at HF third anniversary, Pours a hazy golden with thick fluffy head. Aroma has some classic HF dank and resin to it but is mostly tropical fruits forward. Lots of pinneaples, oranges, peaches, etc. Taste is also along those lines with a distinctive citrus acidity to balance the grassy bitterness. Full bodied and highly drinkable.

On tap at Hill Farmstead during their Third Anniversary Party.  Pours a hazed gold under a medium to large sized white head.  Bright citrus with light musk. Medium, big citrus, lots of malty earthiness and big citrus.  Loads of citrus, grapefruit and pith.  Lovely.
tap at hill farmstead anniversary party. pleasant floral and tropical fruit hop character.   dry toasted tangerine sweetness provides balance.  some resin.   nice.
Apricot colored pour with a white head.  This one is vibrant and leans towards a lot of citrusy flavors with some bitterness and tropical fruits as well.  Enjoyable again.  Nice work Shaun.

Growler: Lemon zest aroma. Hazy golden, thin head. Lilly dominated flavor. Lemon zest and grapefruit present on the back end. Crisp, bitter, and tasty, but not really deserving of the hype, at least not this sample.

From a 750mL growler. 
Aroma is pretty much all hops with only some faint cracker malt character. Hops are very fruity with lots of citrus and tropical fruit with a bit of a vinous character. 
Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a pillowy white head. Light lacing and medium low legs. 
Flavor is very hop forward with some light biscuit and cracker malt character. The hops are very vinous with moderate tropical fruit notes and some light citrus but the citrus is fainter. The bitterness is high but clean. Moderately dry. Slight alcohol spice in the finish. Tastes a bit less than perfectly fresh. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodies with medium low carbonation. Astringency is low and only due to the hops. Alcohol warmth is medium low. 
Overall a good beer, but it's not as fresh as it could be. Fairly dry and a great example of Mosaic hops. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Chilled 75 cl flip-top growler, brought to the tasting by Josh, poured into a sample glass in a three side by side blind.  Pours golden with medium white head.  Taste is nice slightly spicy grapefruit.  Medium body, medium carbonation, and aroma is lighter hops.  My favorite of the three, but the aroma is light and the taste is pretty good.

750 ml growler shared at a tasting. Pours a semi hazy gold with a white ring of lacing. Mildly fruity and citrusy in the nose. Some fruit and acidity come through, like you would find in an orange. Its not sour by any stretch of the imagination, but it does have a sort of fruity zing.

750 ml bottle from Tooch. Thanks, dude! Epic share. Pours a well hazed dulled golden straw hue, some natural apple sauce middle and some orange dulled golden glow. Straw, big cakey offwhite head atop sticks around and laces well, stays large. Big and fluffy. Aromas are earthy, some nice citrus, gentle tropical fruit, some florals and pine. Some earthy grass and florals, firmer bitterness but nice hopping, solid bitterness, weeds, and florals. Initial is considerably more pleasant, lemon and florals meet, some gentle grapefruit, a bit of juicy citrus. Lemons, florals, grass. Firmer bitterness, a bit of juicy middle. Small malt bill is bready, crisp, and gentle cereal. Fruity touches of mango, some more grapefruit. Smaller body, firmly bitter, but not as intense or flavorful as I expected. A lot of melon into middle and backend. Good fruit as it warms a bit more. Pretty tasty. Nicely bitter. Good flavors as it warms. Comes into its own much more with melon and grapefruit. Its not abrasive, but well integrated. Small body, quite drinkable. Really catches on as we move on. Tasty.

A cheerful, lightly hazy golden color tinged with orange, and a fluffy white head. Zesty oranges, grapefruits, hints of lemons, and citrus and floral hops. Lively, sweet, and light-bodied. Alcohol is beautifully well-hidden; this is extremely refreshing and drinkable.

From the tap at the Mad Taco in Waitsfield, VT - beautiful slightly hazy golden color with a warm, white head of small bubbles that sticks around. Light grapefruit/citrus over hops aroma carried by a good carbonation. Flavor kicks off with a bright bitter note, and but mellows out to a softer, deliciously slightly salty aftertaste. Creamy body buoyed by a light carbonation. This is a very versatile, drinkable beer - no special occasion needed.

Growler shared by Drew. Thanks! Pours a hazed Deep gold with a sticky white head. Nose is really nice overall. Some cat piss and tropical fruit to go with grapefruit and resin. A touch of toasty malt as well. Really nice aromatics. On tasting, it has a good tropical fruit and resin thing across the palate, but then in comes some candy-like sweetness. Almost like orange marmalade that I dont like. Its a bit sticky and a hint of booze. Its a shame, the mosaic is used right here but the malt-hop combination doesnt work for me. Damn.

Growler thanks to Adam/Drew, thanks! Pours a clear slightly pale yellow with a near white head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of earthy pine with a bit of grass and a sweet grains. Flavor has resinous pine with a sweet grain backing and just a bit of musty grain.

Growler. Thanks to Adamjackson. Pours hazy orange with a creamy head and lacings. Nose is hops and slight funky yeast. Very fresh and overall lovely. Crisp and really bitter and dry flavor with notes of pine, grapefruit and massive citrus. Delicious.

Growler shared by Dedollewaitor, thanks a bunch. Cloudy orange body with a medium white head. Aroma is fruity,dry, hops, citrus, peach. Flavour is light hops, fruity, dry, citrus. Im a new fan of HF!!

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2013 Growler, pours hazed golden orange with white head. Aroma has some tropical fruit, mango skin, and blood orange. Flavors are tropical and candied fruit with leading into bitterness, and long sweet mango, pinnapple, and melon. Really sugary/candied middle. Wish this could have dried out more. Odd pithy and pinnapple juice finish that is cloying. Long peppery booze finishes. Not really into the finish of this beer. I always have trouble with these double pales, just seems like they would be better suited to just up the bitterness more and just make a iipa, since they come off as weak/sweeter iipas anyway. This could have been much better.

Poured from a 750 into a HF taster. Pours a brilliant opaque orange typical of HF beers. Smells of straw, pine, citrus and a bit of tropical fruit. Taste is pine resin citrus and a pronounced bitterness with a nice dry finish.
growler, orangish pour, big fruity nose & flavor. mango, apricots, tangerines. big bitterness. medium to fuller mouthfeel. another amazing Hill Farmstead beer

Big big thanks to briandot for sharing this growler! Gorgeous peach colored pour with a huge, magnanimous white head and good GOD what a hop profile this has! Richest fruit character Ive ever experienced. Mango, apricot, tangerine, white plum, nectarine... you name it. Still, not sickly sweet, with appropriate bitterness to balance everything out. Legitimately stunning. You would think with the amount of beers Shauns made that I use stunning for it would lose legitimacy as an adjective, but hes just that good.

Un petit verre dans la ligne sur place. Liquide orangé avec une belle mousse crémeuse. Au nez tout est en agrumes, des oranges entre autre. Cest très invitant à linstar des autres produits Hill. En bouche le liquide disparait à la vitesse de léclair, cest bon de la marmelade amère liquide. Autre belle réussite.

Freshly pulled from the tap today and consumed just a few hours later.  Thanks buddy... Pours s semi-hazy peach apricot orange brown, homogenous throughout, and topped with a frothy white head that dissipates to a thin wispy film... Aroma has a hoppy bitterness that youd expect with a citrus grapefruit focus upfront with more of a juicy lightly dank tropical fruit feel taking over halfway through and lingering from that point forward. A pale clean malt bill accentuates the aforementioned... Flavors follow suit to a tee and fortunately so.  Dank herbal tropical fruits that mosaic usually serves up in a very clean and presentable manner.  Additional notes of citrus and grapefruit and its associated pithy rind bitterness that rounds things out and prolonging through the finish. A touch of sweetness through the middle before the bitterness catches up pin the end. Medium bodied or seems just shy thereof.  Drinks very easy and no sensing of the abv untill after after I crushed my pour so fast.  Just what I was looking for and delectably executed.  Another winner but I may like 5 a whisker more?  Who cares at this point....
Lots of citrius.  More than just about anything ive had.  Sour grapefruit taste.    No bitterness at all.
NO SURPRISE  THAT SHAUN PUT OUT ANOTHER GREAT S +S IM ALL IN. jUST HAD ONE AT THE REZ IN WATERBURY VT YUMMY!!

Pour from a growler sent out from Vermont. Nice light golden color with appropriate white head. The aroma was fresh with citrus and light tropical notes. Smooth and medium mouthfeel. The flavor s were total Mosaic to me with pineapple, lemon, grapefruit and a certain earthiness that this hop provides. Bitterness was just right as are all the HF IPAs. No heat either to the beer. Very good.

67 oz. Growler directly from the brewery. Nice hazy gold with thin ring of white head. Nose is a wonderful blend of grapefruit, tropical fruit simply packed with citrus. Flavor is much like the nose. Packed with LARGE tropical fruit, citrus flavors galore. Grapefruit, peach, lemon and a light Earthy note. The hop variety is slightly different. Mouthfeel has a nice effervescence. Real active. Very nice brew yet, personally I liked 5 slightly better. This is still really tasty in its own right.

Hazy orange pour with a white head. Bright grapefruit, pineapple, and tangerine nose. Pine, light malt sweetness, very tropical, peach, and mango. The flavor is very citric. Great grapefruit, pineapple, peach, and mango. Nice pine, sweet bread, and a nice bitterness to it.

Growler. Pours a cloudy golden with thin white head. Aroma is pineapple, peach and mango up front. Very nice smells with a little dankness. Taste is pineapple, mango and slight malt. A little too bitter if anything. Still a freaking awesome beer.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
2 Litre growler fresh from the brewery. Enjoyed at a painfully cold fridge temperature in a Teku glass. Side-Note, already 24 reviews on this beer? Man, Hill Farmstead is blowing up. Never seen an HFS IPA get so many reviews so quickly. 

A -  Looks similar to almost every other DIPA from Shaun. A sort of cloudy peach color with a minimal fast fading solid white head.

S - The nose is awesome. Very tropical. Lots of mango and pineapple. Sort of an orange peel scent as well. 

T -  Incredibly hoppy. IBU has to be high 90s and that may be the only downside to this beer. The taste is great, also carrying that pineapple but with the added pine cone character with lemon zest. Its a very fruity beer but the lingering bitterness lingers for a little too long and youre forced to drink more to get the bitterness off the palate. 

M - Medium body, really nice carbonation balance. For someone who has had a lot of cough syrup lately (recovering from the flu), it does have that booziness at the finish.

O - This is a great IPA but not my favorite in the Society series. 5 and 2 really shine as the winners here. Still, a great beer from a great brewery.

From growler.
Pours sligthly hazy blond with low white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of tropical fruits, malt, herbs. Taste is of tropical fruits, citrus. Palate: Ligth body, oily texture. Overall: Heavy bitterness. This "Mosaic" stuff is good.

750mL growler, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany!), pours a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Extremely aromatic nose full of pine, fresh meadows, floral hops, and tropical fruits - a bit of biscuity malt to back as well. Flavour brings out loads of piney, resinous and floral hops, medium presence of tropical fruits (peach, mango, pineapple), and a bit of caramel and biscuity malt in the back. Extremely delicious bunch of flavours as with the whole Society & Solitude series - this time with the mosaic hops delivering a balance of tropical fruits and piney and resinous hops, all with that signature Hill Farmstead quality to it. Awesome stuff.

Growler thanks to briandot. Pours a full haze deep mango juice golden. Thick beige foam. Webby lacing. Nose is excellent passionfruit, papaya, pomegranate, fresh blood orange, papaya. Taste is so fresh and juicy: pulpy passionfruit, mango, mangosteen, blood orange with rind, papaya, I mean- all of the beautiful fruit flavors I have come to love. Palate is buoyant, quenching, refreshing. Void of all the things I hate about DIPAs: stickiness, cheesiness, nuttiness, astringency. This is just an incredible experience that is slowly restoring my faith in a style that is riddled with disgusting, undrinkable filth.

growler. hazy pale yellow with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. grapefruit, tropicalness, apricots-peaches, crisp pale malts. herbal-citrusy short to medium long finish. good balance. pleasant surprise from this single hop version - not the greatest depth though. average to soft carbonation, creamy yet light bodied. very nice offering!

great hop presence on this. talked to the brewer and they got on box of mosaic hops and blew the whole box on this beer. Nice and bitter with a resinous piney note. Also hits on peach notes. To me taste was the same as the smell but jucier.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2013 Growler at home, thanks Nate!!! Pour is hazy, golden-orange with a bright white head and great lacing. Tropical, peachy, orange, grapefruit, and tangy aroma - other notes of straw, tangerines, and orange. Taste is juicy, biscuity, somewhat floral, resiny, lightly spicy, tangy, touches of pineapple, and mango with a medium bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. I had New Belgiums Rampant last night, which wasnt bad, but it doesnt compare to this one. Very well-balanced and fruity, and super easy drinking for a DIPA. Not overly harsh or aggressive - nice showcase of Mosaic hops.

Pours a murky orange into my Hill Farmstead tulip. Two finger sized white head that last a considerably long time. Nice lacing. The aroma is awesome.Citrus, tropical fruit and some pine.  Bitterness is balance with a touch of malt.Finishes dry as a bone. Awesome beer. Mosiac is an amazing hop only made better by the craftman @ Hill Farmstead.

On tap many places during last weeks trip to Vermont, but the first glass was on tap at the source.  Nose releases a beautiful bouquet of orange peel, faint tropical notes, and a bit of pine.  Mosaic is apparently a winner.  Flavor is quite fruity yet also very bitter.  Mouthfeel is near perfection, as is almost always the case with HF hoppy offerings.  Supremely drinkable.  One of my favorite HF IPAs yet.

Growler generously shared at the Pre-Hunahpu Tasting.  Pours a hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is some light malt with a huge tropical fruit, grass, lemon, and citrus flavor.  Flavor follows with lemon, tropical fruit, and some grass.  A bruiser and a bitter beast.  Light to medium in body and memorable.

En fût sur place.  Une robe orange et son col bien monté.  Une dentelle immortelle.  Un nez complètement soumis à la dictature des agrumes, des mangues, des pêches et autres merveilles jaunes et orangées.  Sur les papilles, des houblons juteux et frais comme une salade tropicale qui révèle même des actions poivrées et florales.  Un malt à qui on ne demande que lessentiel.  Une bouche pleine de vie.  Une finale amère de houblons fruités et piquants.  Beaucoup trop facile à boire.

750 mL growler. Thanks so much to Thorpe for getting this for me.

The beer is hazy and orange with a half inch off off white head. The aroma brings a wonderful bouquet of hops, citrus, tropical fruit, mango. Sweet tropical fruits with bitter citric hops. Lovely flavor. Oranges and mangos with a touch of warming alcohol in the finish. Pleasant lingering bitterness. Medium in body with soft carbonation. Not my favorite of the Society and Solitude series thus far, but this is certainly a delicious beer. Hill Farmstead strikes yet again.

On tap at the brewery. A hazy golden pour leaves a massive white head that leaves thick heavy lace, and lasts throughout the glass. Mosaic has quickly become one of my all time favorite varietals from my own brewing exploits, so it was super interesting to see how Hill Farmstead incorporated it into a hop forward beer. The hop itself reminds me of a cross between Columbus and Citra. Huge herbal pungent dankness with hints of scallion (Summit in nature, but not quite to the same degree), leading to a bursting onslaught of berry, nectar fruit, and tropical fruit. Very light and unobtrusive malt character, letting the vibrant nature of the hops shine. The body is light and crisp for the style, but the palate fills up nicely with caressing effervescence. Super dry finish. Very grateful to have shared this with great company, and looking forward to more in the future!

Big blast of hops in the nose; guess that's what Mosiac hops smell like. Delicious.

More hop resin & bite than I usually like, yet the big malt base brings everything into balance. Leaves a pleasant bitterness on the palate, excellent overall.

On-tap in my kitchen.

Pours a mirky orange/yellow color, white frothy head, super-sticky lacing, thick ring, and thin cap. Nose is mango-forward, tropical, smooth hops, grass, light pine...really well-balanced and smooth. Flavor is lots of mango, pineapple, hops, grassy...perfect balance of hoppy bitterness and sweetness. Body is light to medium, good carbonation, oily finish.

Its hard to think of another DIPA I would rather drink more of in one session. The alcohol is well-hidden, its very-well balanced, and the flavor profile is simply right-on. I have to say, my other favorite easy-drinking DIPA is Heady Topper, and this is superior.

750ml growler, thanks Justin.

Poured Orange with two finger head.  Beautiful lacing from first to last sip

Nose is a mixture of citrus and mango.  Flavor follows suit with the nose only more tropical and citric. Slight pepper and grass like quality on the finish.  Overall this was delicious but still prefer 5 over 6 as I really enjoyed the grapefruit blast it packed

Growler shared by Thorpe at Bue Lobster, Thanks ! Pours a slightly hazy orange golden color with a finger of white fizzy foam. The nose is a tropical explosion of grapefruit, mango and peach. The palate follows the nose from begining to end with a touch of spicy earth sneaking in mid to late palate, which adds a nice complexity and contrast to the fruit. Mouthfeel is spot on with just enough carbonation to make the flavors pop ! Thanks for sharing.

750 mL growler kindly delivered to my door by the Thorpes on their trek back to DC.  

Pours a hazy light straw golden amber with a large white head that fades to a thick collar and film with patchy clumps of lace.  Aroma starts with sweaty and juicy tropical hops: mango, passion fruit, tangerine, and lime.  Theres also some bready and pale malt and some grass and pepper spice on the finish.  Flavor starts from the front of the palate bitter and peppery that persists throughout the sweet and fruity body.  There is a persistent doughy malt base that blends nicely the grassy hop bitterness and juicy tropical notes.  Fruit presence tends more toward tangerine, nectarine, mango and citrus skin than the nose.  Full bodied, with soft carbonation and a dry, smooth finish.  Aftertaste of resin, grass, bread and hoppy bitterness.  I like the mix of styles of beer in this series instead of sticking to just making massive IIPAs showcasing a different hop each time.  This is another winner.

Wow it tastes like tropical fruit salad.  Huge peach, grapefruit, and mango presence with nice moderate bittering and medium sweet body.  Just amazingly juicy and hoppy.  Really looking forward to more use of this hop.

Growler (750 ml) filled at Hill Farmstead earlier today. Hazy yellow/golden with a frothy white head and intense lacing (as usual with HF brews) and good retention. Aroma is of grapefruits and intense tropical fruits along with slight resinous notes, really fresh and interesting. Taste is moderately bitter with strong tropical fruits and some resinous notes. Theres also some onion in there. Dry and bitter finish. medium body. Very Good DIPA, but could use a little more balance.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2014 Growlers courtesy of Vinny at Franks. Pours a bright, hazy orange body with nice white lacing. Aroma is super fresh citrus burst, light funk and light tropical fruits. Mouthfeel is medium with notes citrus, grapefruit, melons, nectarines, light cheese, light funk and oranges. Awesome.
Mosiac hop imperial Pale Ale.  mangos, peaches, apricots, pine, tropical citrus, massive hop aromas and flavors.  nothing else to say.
Thank you Shaun for making these beers. I love what flavors he has extracted from this hop. Grapefruit and tropical fruit juice

After a sample earlier at the brewery Im finally sitting down to a full glass of this stuff. From a 750ml growler filled not even ten hours ago.

A - Pours a hazy dark yellow body. Holding it up to the light provides a vibrant ripe peach color. Loads and loads of soapy bone white foam with long lasting retention. Looks perfect.

S - So this is mosaic huh? Huge blast of nectarines, mango and grapefruit. Bitter, sweet, ripe, and juicy with a hint of the danky dank. Has a sort of chalky dry finish.

T - Ripe nectarines and juicy peaches and mango. The finish is lightly bitter. Clean and super tasty, unbelievably juicy fruits here.

M - Medium bodied with nice carbonation. The bitterness does get a bit overwhelming after a glass.

O - This is just excellent, excellent stuff. I still prefer #5 over this beer, but if this is what Mosaic is like than I am all aboard that train.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 On tap at the brewery with Eric, Alen, and Joe. We were stoked to here this got put on as we were driving to Greensboro for the bottle release. Needed something juicy after a scary drive in a VT snow storm, shit meh. Pours hazy orange with 2 finger white head, tiny bubbles and good lacing retention. Aromas and flavor of super dank, oniony, citrus hops. Lots of oily pine, grapefruit, cheese and other resinous flavors. Very light malt with a bitter finish, Its got a little bit of the scallion flavor that can be too much at times. Think a little more sweet malt would have made this great and balanced the hefty amount of mosaic hops. Very good ipa but not in my top 3 of the society and solitudes I have tried so far. Rerate, tried out of growler 2 days after first tapping, much better, tangerine, citrus, and light malts. Think it was too fresh before.
